<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CYBERSECURITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/06/twitch-hit-with-major-security-breach?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Twitch Gets Pwned by Anonymous Hacker
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/06/twitch-hit-with-major-security-breach?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Twitch logo as a broken lock leaking purple fluid" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/737ae04337e264dcfa969d671c58f3265a8ca875-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A hacker <a href="https://www.videogameschronicle.com/news/the-entirety-of-twitch-has-reportedly-been-leaked/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">poured out</a> a Big Gulp of Twitch’s data yesterday, uploading 125 GB of stolen secrets from the streaming platform to the anonymous imageboard site 4chan. The leaked data includes...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1) All of the platform’s source code, including the changes made to the code dating back to Twitch’s 2011 launch.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2) The deets on a rumored competitor to Steam, a popular online game store. Apple, Sony, Nintendo, and Microsoft <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-doesnt-make-videogames-but-its-the-hottest-player-in-gaming-11633147211?st=x3tad5ypqtit2gk&reflink=desktopwebshare_permalink" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all run</a> lucrative gaming stores, and apparently, Amazon (which owns Twitch) is feeling FOMO. It's been flailing around the gaming space for about a decade, but launched its <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-05/new-world-game-is-a-hit-and-amazon-sees-big-future-for-gaming?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first hit</a> video game, <em>New World</em>, last week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3) Records of how much creators have been paid for streaming on Twitch since August 2019...and it’s a fair amount:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>81 streamers have earned $1+ million since August 2019.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The top five earners all made $5+ million.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Critical Role, a group of voice actors who stream themselves playing </span><span><em>Dungeons & Dragons</em></span><span>, was the top earner at nearly $10 million.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why go after Twitch?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The hacker wrote that they want to “foster more disruption and competition in the online video streaming space” because Twitch’s community “is a disgusting toxic cesspool.” Notably, they included #DoBetterTwitch in their post on 4chan, a hashtag that was popularized earlier this year by gamers boycotting Twitch over “hate raids”—when users band together to barrage a channel with insults.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The video game industry has been put on blast this year for fostering toxic behavior and hate speech. Gaming giant Activision Blizzard <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/22/california-sues-gaming-company-activision-blizzard?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">was sued</a> in July for its “pervasive ‘frat boy’ culture” and mistreatment of female employees.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the hacker ominously labeled this “part one” of “an extremely <a href="https://www.polygon.com/2018/5/14/17335670/twitch-emotes-meaning-list-kappa-monkas-omegalul-pepe-trihard?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">poggers</a> leak.”<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/06/us-gas-prices-hit-their-highest-level-in-seven-years?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
One Full Gas Tank or a New House: You Decide
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A gallon of gas in the US <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/06/americans-are-paying-the-most-for-gas-in-seven-years.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cost $3.22</a> on average yesterday, according to the AAA—that’s the most expensive price since at least October 2014.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pour one out for Mono County, CA, where motorists are paying more than $5 a gallon.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Gas prices are rising in lockstep with oil. US crude oil prices hit their highest level in seven years after OPEC+, a powerful group of oil producing nations, decided <em>not </em>to drastically increase production despite calls from the US to ramp it up.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sticker shock at the pump is getting so...shocking that the US is considering the nuclear option: releasing oil from the strategic petroleum reserve to add new supply to the market. Located near the Gulf of Mexico, this reserve is the world’s largest emergency stockpile of crude oil, storing 617.8 million barrels last week, <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/42c9f6c3-ad59-42a3-b9c2-1d79850f96af?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the FT</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Energy markets everywhere are going haywire. Gas prices in Europe <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/natural-gas-prices-take-wild-ride-after-putin-comments-11633541137?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">skyrocketed</a> nearly 40% earlier in the day, but closed lower after Russian President Vladimir Putin said that Russia could provide more gas to Europe to avert a crisis.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/06/first-ever-malaria-drug-is-endorsed-by-world-health-organization?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Great (Non-Covid) Vaccine News
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Spikevax isn’t the only vaccine name you need to learn. Mosquirix, the first vaccine to prevent malaria, was <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/575579-who-endorses-first-vaccine-for-malaria?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">endorsed</a> by the WHO yesterday. The four-dose vaccine, combined with other preventative methods like bed nets, could save as many as 23,000 children from dying every year. And as the NYT <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/06/health/malaria-vaccine-who.html?partner=slack&smid=sl-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pointed out</a>, it’s also the first vaccine to ever be developed against a parasitic disease, period.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pedro Alonso, the director of the WHO’s global malaria program, said that the vaccine is a historic breakthrough in the fight against an infectious disease that kills 400,000+ people every year, mostly in sub-Saharan Africa. More than half of those are children under the age of five.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The malaria parasite is especially dangerous because even if it doesn’t kill its host, it can weaken the host’s immune system, creating even more health problems down the line.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the vaccine has to be approved by Gavi, the global vaccine alliance. And, with Covid still at the forefront of health officials’ minds, it could take years to become widely available.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>26 words of Korean origin were <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/newsbeat-58749976?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">added</a> to the Oxford English Dictionary in September, including bulgogi, K-drama, and banchan. It shows that “we are all riding the crest of the Korean wave,” per the OED. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I do worry that as companies get to be more successful, the number of attacks from press, politicians, and trolls on CEOs (and rounds of congressional testimony) makes the job not fun, and they leave from burn out.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong, who has been in his fair share of tussles with regulators, wrote in a <a href="https://twitter.com/brian_armstrong/status/1445604556121919492?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter thread</a> that overbearing scrutiny could lead to a brain drain of executive talent.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Art often draws inspiration from life—but what happens when it’s <em>your</em> life? <!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/06/nestle-to-launch-plant-based-shrimp-substitute-called-vrimp?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vrimp Cocktail, Anyone?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/06/nestle-to-launch-plant-based-shrimp-substitute-called-vrimp?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Scene from Forrest Gump" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0cea46ecbc639bdd9494f780eeb05db6eb17cad6-1324x862.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Rohan Iruthayaraj</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nestlé, hungry for a taste of the fast-growing vegan market, is launching <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/business/2021/oct/06/vrimp-shrimp-nestle-faux-seafood-seaweed?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plant-based substitutes</a> for eggs and shrimp. The shrimp substitute, called “vrimp,” is made from a combo of seaweed, peas, and elephant yam roots to give it a shrimp-like flavor and texture.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Vrimp and the soy-based egg alternative, known as vEGGie (come on, just call it seggs you cowards), will be introduced in select European markets.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Alt-foods aren’t new.</strong> With almost one-in-four people worldwide trying to limit their consumption of animal products, there are a bajillion startups trying to build vrimp empires.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nestlé is reportedly eyeing some acquisition targets, but it’s spending most of its resources trying to conquer the plant-based space on its own. And it has a <em>lot</em> of resources—Nestlé is the largest food company in the world.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Don't be in the prawn place at the wrong time.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than a <em>Bachelor in Paradise</em> relationship. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>

The leaked data includes...\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e1) All of the platform’s source code, including the changes made to the code dating back to Twitch’s 2011 launch.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2) The deets on a rumored competitor to Steam, a popular online game store. Apple, Sony, Nintendo, and Microsoft \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-doesnt-make-videogames-but-its-the-hottest-player-in-gaming-11633147211?st=x3tad5ypqtit2gk\u0026reflink=desktopwebshare_permalink\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eall run\u003c/a\u003e lucrative gaming stores, and apparently, Amazon (which owns Twitch) is feeling FOMO. It's been flailing around the gaming space for about a decade, but launched its \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-10-05/new-world-game-is-a-hit-and-amazon-sees-big-future-for-gaming?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst hit\u003c/a\u003e video game, \u003cem\u003eNew World\u003c/em\u003e, last week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e3) Records of how much creators have been paid for streaming on Twitch since August 2019...and it’s a fair amount:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e81 streamers have earned $1+ million since August 2019.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe top five earners all made $5+ million.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eCritical Role, a group of voice actors who stream themselves playing \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eDungeons \u0026 Dragons\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, was the top earner at nearly $10 million.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy go after Twitch?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe hacker wrote that they want to “foster more disruption and competition in the online video streaming space” because Twitch’s community “is a disgusting toxic cesspool.” Notably, they included #DoBetterTwitch in their post on 4chan, a hashtag that was popularized earlier this year by gamers boycotting Twitch over “hate raids”—when users band together to barrage a channel with insults.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe video game industry has been put on blast this year for fostering toxic behavior and hate speech. Gaming giant Activision Blizzard \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/22/california-sues-gaming-company-activision-blizzard?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewas sued\u003c/a\u003e in July for its “pervasive ‘frat boy’ culture” and mistreatment of female employees.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe hacker ominously labeled href=\"https://www.polygon.com/2018/5/14/17335670/twitch-emotes-meaning-list-kappa-monkas-omegalul-pepe-trihard?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eGas prices are rising in lockstep with oil. US crude oil prices hit their highest level in seven years after OPEC+, a powerful group of oil producing nations, decided \u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003eto drastically increase production despite calls from the US to ramp it up.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSticker shock at the pump is getting so...shocking that the US is considering the nuclear option: releasing oil from the strategic petroleum reserve to add new supply to the market. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSpikevax isn’t the only vaccine name you need to learn. Mosquirix, the first vaccine to prevent malaria, was \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/575579-who-endorses-first-vaccine-for-malaria?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eendorsed\u003c/a\u003e by the WHO yesterday. The four-dose vaccine, combined with other preventative methods like bed nets, could save as many as 23,000 children from dying every year. And as the NYT \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/06/health/malaria-vaccine-who.html?partner=slack\u0026smid=sl-share\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epointed out\u003c/a\u003e, it’s also the first vaccine to ever be developed against a parasitic disease, period.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePedro Alonso, the director of the WHO’s global malaria program, said that the vaccine is a historic breakthrough in the fight against an infectious disease that kills 400,000+ people every year, mostly in sub-Saharan Africa. More than half of those are children under the age of five.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe malaria parasite is especially dangerous because even if it doesn’t kill its host, it can weaken the host’s immune system, creating even more health problems down the line.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe vaccine has to be approved by Gavi, the global vaccine alliance. And, with Covid still at the forefront of health officials’ minds, it could take years to become widely available.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL
